sourcesContent:
export const NEWS_DATA = [
    {"year":1947,"title":"India Achieves Independence; Flag Hoisted at Fort St. George","summary":"On August 15, 1947, India gained independence. In Madras, the first Premier of the province, O. P. Ramaswamy Reddiyar, hoisted the national flag at Fort St. George.","source_name":"Historical Archives","rank":1},
    {"year":1947,"title":"Madras Temple Entry Authorization Act Passed","summary":"The government passed the Madras Temple Entry Authorization Act, 1947, a landmark social reform granting all classes of Hindus the right to enter Hindu temples.","source_name":"Legislative Records","rank":2},
    {"year":1947,"title":"Devadasi Dedication Abolition Act Enacted","summary":"The government outlawed the practice of dedicating girls to Hindu temples as 'Devadasis'.","source_name":"Legislative Records","rank":3},
    {"year":1947,"title":"M.G. Ramachandran Debuts as Hero in 'Rajakumari'","summary":"M.G. Ramachandran (MGR) starred in his first lead role in the film Rajakumari.","source_name":"Film History Archives","rank":4},
    {"year":1947,"title":"Famine Scars and Food Scarcity","summary":"The state, still recovering from the 1946 famine, faced severe food scarcity. The government promoted wheat as an alternative to rice and temporarily banned serving rice-based foods like idlis in hotels.","source_name":"The Hindu Archives","rank":5},
    {"year":1948,"title":"Madras Public Libraries Act Passed","summary":"The state passed the Madras Public Libraries Act, the first of its kind in India. It established a structured framework for a public library system, with the Connemara Public Library designated as the State Central Library.","source_name":"Legislative Records","rank":1},
    {"year":1948,"title":"First Government-Owned Airplane Purchased","summary":"The Madras government, under Premier O. P. Ramaswamy Reddiyar, became the first in India to purchase its own aircraft, a de Havilland Dove, for official administrative travel.","source_name":"The Hindu","rank":2},
    {"year":1948,"title":"Gandhi Assassination Shocks Madras","summary":"The assassination of Mahatma Gandhi on January 30, 1948, led to widespread mourning and hartals across Madras State.","source_name":"Historical News Archives","rank":3},
    {"year":1948,"title":"'Naam Iruvar' Film Released","summary":"The film Naam Iruvar was released, known for its patriotic songs by Subramania Bharati and social messaging.","source_name":"Film History Archives","rank":4},
    {"year":1948,"title":"Political Rivalry in Congress","summary":"K. Kamaraj successfully supported O. P. Ramaswamy Reddiyar against T. Prakasam for party leadership, solidifying his role as kingmaker.","source_name":"Political History Records","rank":5},
    {"year":1949,"title":"Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) is Formed","summary":"On September 17, 1949, C.N. Annadurai, M. Karunanidhi, and others split from E.V. Ramasamy's Dravidar Kazhagam to form DMK, reshaping state politics.","source_name":"Political History Records","rank":1},
    {"year":1949,"title":"P. S. Kumaraswamy Raja Becomes Premier","summary":"Following O. P. Ramaswamy Reddiyar's resignation, P. S. Kumaraswamy Raja took over as the last Premier of Madras Presidency on April 6, 1949.","source_name":"Government of Tamil Nadu Archives","rank":2},
    {"year":1949,"title":"Agitation for 'Greater Andhra'","summary":"The demand for a separate Telugu-speaking state called Andhra with Madras city as its capital gained momentum.","source_name":"Historical Archives","rank":3},
    {"year":1949,"title":"'Velaikaari' Film Released","summary":"The film Velaikaari, with screenplay by C.N. Annadurai, propagated rationalist and social reform ideals of DMK.","source_name":"Film History Archives","rank":4},
    {"year":1949,"title":"Abolition of Zamindari System","summary":"Madras Estate Act abolished the Zamindari system and transferred rights to cultivators.","source_name":"Legislative Records","rank":5},
    {"year":1950,"title":"Madras Presidency Becomes 'Madras State'","summary":"On January 26, 1950, the Madras Presidency was renamed Madras State under the Constitution of India.","source_name":"Constitution of India","rank":1},
    {"year":1950,"title":"Republic Day Celebrations","summary":"The first Republic Day celebrated with P.S. Kumaraswamy Raja unfurling the national flag.","source_name":"News Archives","rank":2},
    {"year":1950,"title":"'Ezhai Padum Padu' Film Released","summary":"Film adaptation of Les Miserables highlighting social justice and poverty.","source_name":"Film History Archives","rank":3},
    {"year":1950,"title":"Rise of Communist Movements","summary":"Communist activities increased advocating land rights and wages for laborers.","source_name":"Political History Records","rank":4},
    {"year":1950,"title":"Food Controls and Rationing","summary":"Continued controls and rationing on rice and sugar due to scarcity.","source_name":"News Archives","rank":5},
    {"year":1951,"title":"First General Elections Begin","summary":"Preparations began for India's first general elections including Madras State.","source_name":"Election Commission of India Archives","rank":1},
    {"year":1951,"title":"First Five-Year Plan Launched","summary":"Focus on agriculture, irrigation, and power projects like Lower Bhavani Dam.","source_name":"Planning Commission Records","rank":2},
    {"year":1951,"title":"'Parasakthi' Production Begins","summary":"Film production began with dialogues by M. Karunanidhi and debut of Sivaji Ganesan.","source_name":"Film History Archives","rank":3},
    {"year":1951,"title":"Mettur Dam and Pykara Power Projects Expand","summary":"Major expansions for irrigation and electricity generation.","source_name":"Government Reports","rank":4},
    {"year":1951,"title":"Census of 1951","summary":"First census of independent India recorded over 57 million population in Madras State.","source_name":"Census of India","rank":5},
    {"year":1952,"title":"Potti Sreeramulu Fasts and Dies for Andhra State","summary":"Telugu leader Potti Sreeramulu's fast for a separate Telugu state led to his death and widespread protests.","source_name":"Historical Archives","rank":1},
    {"year":1952,"title":"First Assembly Elections; Hung Assembly","summary":"No party won a majority, Congress largest followed by Communist-led front.","source_name":"Election Commission of India Archives","rank":2},
    {"year":1952,"title":"C. Rajagopalachari Becomes CM","summary":"Rajaji nominated as Chief Minister, controversial as unelected by popular vote.","source_name":"Political History Records","rank":3},
    {"year":1952,"title":"'Parasakthi' Film Release Causes Uproar","summary":"Sharp dialogues attacking caste and social inequality led to demands to ban the film.","source_name":"Film History Archives","rank":4},
    {"year":1952,"title":"Sivaji Ganesan Debuts","summary":"Marked debut of Sivaji Ganesan as film superstar.","source_name":"Film History Archives","rank":5},
    {"year":1953,"title":"Andhra State Formed; Madras City Remains with State","summary":"Telugu districts separated; Madras city retained as Tamil capital.","source_name":"States Reorganisation Commission Records","rank":1},
    {"year":1953,"title":"Rajaji Introduces 'Kula Kalvi Thittam'","summary":"Introduced controversial vocational education scheme, sparking protests.","source_name":"Political History Records","rank":2},
    {"year":1953,"title":"'Avvaiyar' Film Becomes Cultural Milestone","summary":"Celebrated mythological film portrayal of poetess Avvaiyar.","source_name":"Film History Archives","rank":3},
    {"year":1953,"title":"Dravidar Kazhagam Protests","summary":"Periyar led protests against caste and Hindi imposition.","source_name":"Political History Records","rank":4},
    {"year":1953,"title":"Lower Bhavani Dam Completed","summary":"Irrigation project key to first five-year plan completed.","source_name":"Government Reports","rank":5},
    {"year":1954,"title":"K. Kamaraj Becomes Chief Minister","summary":"Following opposition to Rajaji's education scheme, Kamaraj was elected Chief Minister on April 13, 1954.","source_name":"Government Archives","rank":1},
  {"year":1954,"title":"Kamaraj Scraps 'Kula Kalvi Thittam'","summary":"Kamaraj immediately rescinded Rajaji's controversial Modified Scheme of Elementary Education, widely applauded by the masses.","source_name":"Government Archives","rank":2},
  {"year":1954,"title":"'Andha Naal' Film Breaks Norms","summary":"The thriller film 'Andha Naal' was released, notable for having no songs or dance sequences, winning critical acclaim.","source_name":"Film Archives","rank":3},
  {"year":1954,"title":"French Rule Ends in Puducherry","summary":"On November 1, French colonial rule in Puducherry and Karaikal ended, and the regions merged with Indian Union.","source_name":"Historical Records","rank":4},
  {"year":1954,"title":"Kamaraj's Focus on Education","summary":"Beginnings of massive school openings and educational reforms aiming for free and compulsory primary education.","source_name":"Government Reports","rank":5},
  {"year":1955,"title":"Integral Coach Factory Inaugurated","summary":"Nehru inaugurated the Integral Coach Factory in Avadi, a landmark in heavy engineering in Madras State.","source_name":"Indian Railways","rank":1},
  {"year":1955,"title":"Soviet Leaders Visit Madras","summary":"Nikolai Bulganin and Nikita Khrushchev visited Madras, touring industrial projects and receiving public adulation.","source_name":"The Hindu","rank":2},
  {"year":1955,"title":"Avadi Congress Session","summary":"Indian National Congress held session in Avadi, adopting the slogan for a socialistic pattern of society.","source_name":"Political History","rank":3},
  {"year":1955,"title":"'Gomathiyin Kaadhalan' Released","summary":"Film debut of actress Savitri became an instant hit in Tamil cinema.","source_name":"Film Archives","rank":4},
  {"year":1955,"title":"Periyar's Protest against Hindi Imposition","summary":"Periyar's Dravidar Kazhagam protested vehemently against the imposition of Hindi and caste discrimination.","source_name":"Political History","rank":5},
  {"year":1956,"title":"States Reorganisation Act Implemented","summary":"Linguistic states reorganization reshaped Madras State boundaries, with Malabar district joining Kerala and Kanyakumari joining Madras State.","source_name":"Government Records","rank":1},
  {"year":1956,"title":"Midday Meal Scheme Launched","summary":"Kamaraj introduced free Midday Meal Scheme in schools, significantly increasing rural student enrollments.","source_name":"Government Reports","rank":2},
  {"year":1956,"title":"Neyveli Lignite Corporation Established","summary":"Neyveli Lignite Corporation was formed to exploit lignite deposits and generate energy.","source_name":"Corporate History","rank":3},
  {"year":1956,"title":"Death of Dr. B.R. Ambedkar","summary":"Civil rights leader Ambedkar’s death deeply affected Dalit and reform movements in Madras State.","source_name":"News Archives","rank":4},
  {"year":1956,"title":"'Madurai Veeran' Film Blockbuster","summary":"Blockbuster starring MGR cemented his image as people's hero and future political leader.","source_name":"Film Archives","rank":5},
  {"year":1957,"title":"DMK Enters Electoral Politics","summary":"DMK contested assembly elections for first time, winning 15 seats, with Annadurai winning from Kancheepuram.","source_name":"Election Commission","rank":1},
  {"year":1957,"title":"M. Karunanidhi's Political Debut","summary":"Karunanidhi won from Kulithalai and began his long political career.","source_name":"Political History","rank":2},
  {"year":1957,"title":"Congress Retains Power under Kamaraj","summary":"Congress comfortably won 1957 elections with Kamaraj continuing as Chief Minister.","source_name":"Election Commission","rank":3},
  {"year":1957,"title":"Dravidar Kazhagam Constitution-Burning Protest","summary":"Protests against India's constitution led by Periyar and his cadres, resulting in arrests.","source_name":"Political History","rank":4},
  {"year":1957,"title":"'Mother India' Film Popular","summary":"Hindi film 'Mother India' ran to packed houses across Madras State.","source_name":"Film Archives","rank":5}
  ];
